metadata.title: CVE-2020-26950 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
In certain circumstances, the MCallGetProperty opcode can be emitted withunmet assumptions resulting in an exploitable use-after-free condition.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 82.0.3, Firefox ESR < 78.4.1, andThunderbird < 78.4.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26950` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
